column3: Is t-SNE affected by the seed?
(perplexity constraint) Are the rows referring to genes or cells?
Run the UMAP without seed a couple of times and compare. Is it more affected than t-SNE? Or less?
column4: UMAP is more sensible, plot has changed drastically
column5: t-SNE is more sensible. UMAP counteracts with its emphasis on global structure.
column7: Being stochastic means that any behaviour can be expected, depends on the seed…

column3: Would decreasing the number of PCs fed onto the clustering algorithm change our visualization? Would you say the results are 'better'?
column4: No, it didn’t change at all
column5: Yes, and it’s better with many PCs
column6: Yes, but it’s worst with many PCs
column7: Yes, and it’s better with few PCs
column8: Yes, but it’s worst with few PCs

column3: Could you have the UMAP projection onto 3 axis instead of 2?
